bug.author: anhhd
bug.summary: UTF-8 characters does not show in st.write
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
UTF-8 characters can not be shown in st.write <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Step 1: Create app.py contains
import streamlit as st st.write('Hiển thị app tiếng Việt')
Step 2: run from terminal streamlit run app.py
<denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.48.0 Python version: 3.7.1 Using Conda OS version: Windows 10 Browser version: Chrome

comments.comment: st.write for plain text is fixed using ftfy module in Python. Example: st.write(ftfy.fix_encoding("Hiển thị app tiếng Việt")) However, st.write for dataframe which contains UTF-8 characters is not fixed

Seems to work fine on latest Streamlit (0.5.5) using Python 3.7.5 on Mac. Closing this since it's fairly old. Please open a new issue if this arises again. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98836/74490310-003b8280-4e7d-11ea-9980-4991ab289b78.png></denchmark-link>
